projects.description: This web app is made for mobile devices. The user can create an account/sign-in and log sets for their exercises. First the user signs in, creates a workout, add exercises for the workout, and then log sets for each exercise. The front end of this app is hosted on Netlify and the back end is hosted on Heroku. The link to the backend code is https://github.com/tford-dev/workout-app-api

This web app was made to display styles and key functionalities of the LinkedIn web app. The functions of this app is to allow the user to sign in with their Google Account(Firebase made this possible), view posts from other google users in the /home route, open a modal, and upload a video link or picture file with a description in the modal. The technologies used in the app is mainly JavaScript, React, Redux, React-Player(A vital dependency for uploading/viewing video links), CSS(Most Css used in app is written using the styled-components dependency), and Google Firebase.

This app is an e-commerce store that was made to replicate the style of the Amazon Web App. The app is made with React, Javascript, CSS, and Firebase(for the backend). This app allows you to create an account, log into your account, add items to purchase into a shopping cart, make payments, and view orders you have made. This app is very simple and light weight and was built for the purpose of learning rather than practical use.

This project is a full stack React CRUD app. The app is mainly a notes app(that can also be used for listing tasks you have) that shows notes based off of who is authorized. Users can not see tasks/notes that they did not create. The database for this app is built with SQL and allows users to create, read, update, and delete tasks/notes.

This project utilizes the Spotify API. The user can sign in with their Spotify account and then view a playlist. The side bar displays playlists that the user has made on Spotify and the tracklist is pulled from the Spotify API. The purpose of this app was to practice front-end developement.
This project is a random quote generator that cycles through an array of quotes and displays them onto the DOM automatically.
This project displays 9 employees on one page that allows users to cycle through 9 employees at a time while on the same page.
This project is a web form that is responsive to user input in real time.
This project is made with ES6 object oriented programming, it allows the user to input letters with a mouse or keyboard to guess the letters of a random phrase.

This project uses the randomuser api. It displays 12 people and allows the user to toggle between each person as well as search each person by name, location, or birthday. This project also features a modal.

This rgb color guessing game was inspired by a project from a course I took, however all of the code was written by me. To play the game, you must click the correct square color based off the CSS rgb color numbers at the top of the screen. The score is based off of the difference of clicked squares and total squares on screen based off of the game mode you're in.

This is a react app for the 7th project in the TeamTreeHouse-Full-Stack-Javascript-Techdegree. The data used in this app comes from the Flickr API. The composition of this app is mostly class components but I did use React Hooks where I absolutely needed it. When navigating through this application, it does take 1-2 seconds before getting a response.

This is the 8th project of the TeamTreehouse-Full-Stack-Javascript-Techdegree. This project uses Sequelize as a method of managing an SQL database. This is a CRUD app for managing data of books for a library. The user can also paginate through books in the database in the '/books' route.

This is the 9th & 10th project of the TeamTreehouse-Full-Stack-Javascript-Techdegree. This is a React CRUD app for courses with a fully functional user authorization feature. The REST API used for this App was crafted with Node, Sequelize, and Express. The frontend(client side) was made with React Js. The git repo for the backend of this app is https://github.com/tford-dev/restApiSql
